subject: Communication
title: The Pitch Narrative: Selling Ideas
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Pitch Narrative: Selling Ideas.

hook.text: Airbnb was rejected by seven investors before a narrative-driven pitch deck raised $600K. Same idea, better story.

buildup.text: Successful pitch decks follow story structure: problem (villain), solution (hero), market (world), team (allies).

discovery.text: Investors don't fund features. They fund narratives about the future that feel inevitable and exciting.

twist.text: The same product pitched as a 'tool' gets ignored. Pitched as a 'movement' or 'mission,' it gets funded.

climax.text: Steve Jobs didn't pitch the iPod as '5GB storage.' He pitched it as '1,000 songs in your pocket.'

punchline.text: Don't pitch features. Pitch the future they create.

quiz.question: How did Steve Jobs pitch the iPod?
